text: if you happen to follow along with my
channnel then you know I haven't posted
much over the past couple of months if
you're a fan of my content then don't
worry I'm not going anywhere the reason
I've not been posting much is due to the
fact that I've been quite busy building
something that's been both really fun
and really exciting related to my
upcoming course this video isn't about
the actual course itself although if you
are interested there's a link in the
description below where you can find out
more instead what I want to talk about
is the fact that I built the entire web
application and platform for hosting
this course from scratch using only go
at the beginning when I was planning out
this course I hadn't actually intended
to build my own course platform and
instead I decided to go for the core
versus context model which is where
anything outside of your actual product
or business model is considered context
and you should only then really build
things related to the core of your
business in this case that would mean
focusing on only building the course
content and Outsourcing the hosting to
another platform so initially I began
doing just that and started looking at
off-the-shelf Solutions with the popular
ones being teachable kajabi and gumroad
however when I was doing my review
looking for the perfect platform to use
none of them really fit the bill as none
of these are what I would exactly call
Affordable some of them take a
percentage of your actual sales and the
others whilst they start at a reasonably
affordable price as soon as you scale up
it gets to be quite expensive not only
this but I really didn't like giving up
control of some of my user data
especially when it came to things such
as user accounts or even purchase
records as I wanted to eventually build
on top of my existing platform in order
to support some other ideas I had in the
future such as more Interactive Learning
as well as doing giveaways by linking
with Discord if you're not part of my
disc Channel I really recommend joining
so in the end I decided to fly in the
face of conventional wisdom and instead
of buying a platform to use I ended up
building one and I'm really glad that I
did of course building an entire
platform or web application from scratch
is certainly more difficult than picking
an off-the-shelf solution as there's a
bunch of things to consider such as tax
remittance for different jurisdictions
web application security and even how to
host and serve the files themselves at
the end of the day however I'm a
software developer and few things bring
me as much joy in this world as writing
code and Building Systems and so for
myself it didn't really make sense to
pass on the opportunity to build a brand
new project just in order to sell
quicker in my opinion there's more to
life than monthly recurring Revenue in
any case only time would tell if this
was the right decision however as I
mentioned I'm really happy with my
choice not just because I have full
control over the platform as it's my
code but it's been a really fun
experience building it and I've learned
a lot perhaps the most enjoyable part of
the whole process is that I've been able
to build a modern web application
without having to use a JavaScript
front-end framework instead I've been
using I think it's called The Goth stack
which is go Temple and HDMX although
I've also added in some other tools that
I really enjoy into this stack such as
Co C when it comes to database
interaction and also a JavaScript
library for the front end Alpine JS
which I've been so impressed with that I
actually have a dedicated video on
coming out later this month for me this
is the first time in a long while that
I've built a full web project from
scratch without using a JavaScript
framework such as react or View and
whilst I have nothing against
javascripts being able to build a full
web application without any of the magic
associated with JavaScript Frameworks
has been extreme ex refreshing so much
so that in the future I think I'm going
to default to using a multipage
application at first and if I do need
more interactivity then I'll probably
look at serving react from either a go
or rust backend or perhaps even taking a
look at a couple of the rust full stack
Frameworks such as leptos or dioxide in
addition to learning how to build a full
modern web application using go I also
got to learn about video streaming using
hls in fact I'm currently building a CLI
tool that will take the master versions
of my videos transpile them into various
different bit rates to support hls and
then upload them onto an S3 compatible
bucket in order for them to be able to
be streamed I actually want to give a
big shout out to both Aaron Francis and
Steve tono from tryhard Studios who have
both shared so much about how they built
their own course platforms which has
both inspired and enabled me because of
how much I learned from them sharing
their knowledge I decided to pay it
forward and plan on doing the same thing
when it comes to my own course platform
creating videos on pretty much every
aspect of how I built it including
things such as the CLI tools that I
built how to add in client side
interactivity without writing your own
JavaScript what infrastructure I'm using
to host the sites as well as the course
videos and even things like how I
restricted access to my Dev SL staging
environment whilst still allowing for
stripe web hooks to make it through
personally I'm really excited to share
that Journey especially as I made a lot
of Stakes going through the entire
process and I'm looking forward to
sharing everything that I learned here
on YouTube all in all the project has
been incredibly fun but it has taken a
toll on my video Cadence both on dreams
of code and dreams of autonomy which I
really need to dedicate some more time
too however a big part of it has been
due to the fact that the course has been
absolutely massive initially I only plan
to build about 20 to 24 videos however
currently I'm up to about 70 videos
planned and with 50 currently being
recorded of course this isn't really a
bad thing as I'm extremely proud of the
level of coverage that the course goes
into especially when it comes to the
comprehensiveness of building CLI
applications when it comes to go because
of this however it has eaten into my
actual video production time when it
comes to YouTube and as my videos tend
to have a lot of production value that
goes into them then this has had a
cascading effect in the future I plan on
doing some more videos in a similar
style to this which is just me yapping
to the camera and sharing my thoughts
although I'm definitely going to go back
to my regularly scheduled programming in
the next month or two in any case I'm
really excited to begin sharing
everything that I've learned through
building out this course application and
I want to give a big thank you to
everyone who supported both me and the
channel and I hope to pay you back by
continuing to produce great content
otherwise that's all for me I'll see you
in the next one
